remarks.format: ## Remarks XML 序列化是将对象的公共属性和字段转换为序列格式（这里是指 XML）以便存储或传输的过程。XML serialization is the process of converting an object's public properties and fields to a serial format (in this case, XML) for storage or transport. 反序列化重新创建中的 XML 输出从其原始状态的对象。Deserialization re-creates the object in its original state from the XML output. 您可以将序列化对象的状态保存到流或缓冲区的方式。You can think of serialization as a way of saving the state of an object into a stream or buffer. 例如，ASP.NET 使用类 XML Web 服务消息进行编码。For example, ASP.NET uses the class to encode XML Web service messages. 对象中的数据是用编程语言构造来描述的，如类、字段、属性、基元类型、数组，甚至 或 对象形式的嵌入 XML。The data in your objects is described using programming language constructs like classes, fields, properties, primitive types, arrays, and even embedded XML in the form of or objects. 您可以创建您自己的类，使用属性，或使用批注[XML 架构定义工具 (Xsd.exe)](~/docs/standard/serialization/xml-schema-definition-tool-xsd-exe.md)生成基于现有 XML 架构定义 (XSD) 文档的类。You have the option of creating your own classes, annotated with attributes, or using the [XML Schema Definition Tool (Xsd.exe)](~/docs/standard/serialization/xml-schema-definition-tool-xsd-exe.md) to generate the classes based on an existing XML Schema definition (XSD) document. 如果您有一个 XML 架构，可以运行 Xsd.exe 生成一组强类型化为架构并使用要遵守架构时序列化属性批注的类。If you have an XML Schema, you can run the Xsd.exe to produce a set of classes that are strongly typed to the schema and annotated with attributes to adhere to the schema when serialized. 若要将数据传输对象和 XML 之间，需要从 XML 架构的编程语言构造和编程语言构造的 XML 架构的映射。To transfer data between objects and XML requires a mapping from the programming language constructs to XML schema and from the XML schema to the programming language constructs. 和 Xsd.exe 等相关的工具提供这两种技术在同时设计时和运行时之间的桥梁。The and related tools like Xsd.exe provide the bridge between these two technologies at both design time and runtime. 在设计时，使用 Xsd.exe 从自定义类生成 XML 架构文档 (.xsd) 或生成给定架构中的类。At design time, use the Xsd.exe to produce an XML schema document (.xsd) from your custom classes or to produce classes from a given schema. 在任一情况下，这些类进行批注和自定义特性来指示如何以 XML 架构系统和公共语言运行时之间进行映射。In either case, the classes are annotated with custom attributes to instruct the how to map between the XML schema system and the common language runtime. 在运行时，这些类的实例可以序列化为 XML 文档，请按照给定的架构。At runtime, instances of the classes can be serialized into XML documents that follow the given schema. 同样，可以将这些 XML 文档反序列化到运行时对象中。Likewise, these XML documents can be deserialized into runtime objects. 请注意，XML 架构是可选的在设计时或运行时并不是必需的。Note that the XML schema is optional, and not required at design time or runtime. ## 控制生成的 XMLControlling Generated XML 若要控制生成的 XML，可以将特殊特性应用于类和成员中。To control the generated XML, you can apply special attributes to classes and members. 例如，若要指定不同的 XML 元素名称，请应用公共字段或属性，以及组属性。For example, to specify a different XML element name, apply an to a public field or property, and set the property. 有关类似属性的完整列表，请参阅[Attributes That Control XML properties of type , or in your strongly typed classes, you can read parts of the XML document directly into XML objects. 如果您使用扩展的 XML 架构，还可以使用和属性进行序列化和反序列化的原始架构中找不到元素或属性。If you work with extensible [System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIgnoreAttribute] public bool FirstOrderSpecified; } ``` ## 重写默认序列化Overriding Default Serialization 你也可以通过创建一个适当的属性，并将其添加到的实例替代的序列化的对象和其字段和属性的任何一组类。You can also override the serialization of any set of objects and their fields and properties by creating one of the appropriate attributes, and adding it to an instance of the class. 重写以这种方式序列化有两个用途： 首先，您可以控制和增强的 DLL Assemblies 若要提高性能，XML 序列化基础结构动态生成要序列化和反序列化指定的类型的程序集。To increase performance, the XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates assemblies to serialize and deserialize specified types. 基础结构找到并重新使用这些程序集。The infrastructure finds and reuses those assemblies. 仅当使用以下构造函数时，会发生此行为：This behavior occurs only when using the following constructors: 如果使用任何其他构造函数，在同一程序集中的多个版本生成，并永远不会卸载，这会导致内存泄漏和性能不佳。If you use any of the other constructors, multiple versions of the same assembly are generated and never unloaded, which results in a memory leak and poor performance. 最简单的解决方案是使用前面提到的两个构造函数之一。The easiest solution is to use one of the previously mentioned two constructors. 否则，你必须缓存中的程序集，如以下示例所示。Otherwise, you must cache the assemblies in a , as XmlSerializer ser = (XmlSerializer)serializers[key]; if (ser == null) { ser = new XmlSerializer(typeof(MyClass), myRoot); // Cache the serializer. serializers[key] = ser; } else { // Use the serializer to serialize, or deserialize. } ``` ```vb Dim serializers As New Hashtable() ' Use the constructor that takes a type and XmlRootAttribute. End If ``` ## ArrayList 和泛型列表的序列化Serialization of ArrayList and Generic List 无法序列化或反序列化以下：The cannot serialize or deserialize the following: - 数组 Arrays of - 数组 Arrays of ## 无符号长整型的枚举的序列化Serialization of Enumerations of Unsigned Long 不能实例化进行序列化一个枚举，如果满足以下条件： 枚举是无符号长整型 (`ulong` C# 中) 和枚举包含的值大于任何成员9,223,372,036,854,775,807。The cannot be instantiated to serialize an enumeration if the following conditions are true: The enumeration is of type unsigned long (`ulong` in C#) and the enumeration contains any member with a value larger than 9,223,372,036,854,775,807. 例如，以下无法序列化。For example, the following cannot be serialized. ``` public enum LargeNumbers: ulong { a = 9223372036854775808 } // At runtime, the following code will fail. xmlSerializer mySerializer=new XmlSerializer(typeof(LargeNumbers)); ``` ## 标记为已过时的属性不能再进行序列化的对象Objects marked with the Obsolete Attribute no longer serialized 在中[!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)]类不能再将对象标记为序列化`[Obsolete]`。In the [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] the class no longer serializes objects that are marked as `[Obsolete]`. ## Examples 下面的示例包含两个主要类：`PurchaseOrder`和`Test`。The following example contains two main classes: `PurchaseOrder` and `Test`. `PurchaseOrder`类包含有关单个的采购信息。The `PurchaseOrder` class contains information about a single purchase. `Test`类包含创建采购订单，并读取创建的采购订单的方法。The `Test` class contains the methods that create the purchase order, and that read the created purchase order. remarks.format: ## Remarks 才会发生事件时用于反序列化包含符合的 World Wide Web 联合会 (www.w3.org) 文档"简单对象访问协议 (SOAP) 1.1"第 5 节的 SOAP 消息的 XML 文档。The event only occurs when the is used to deserialize an XML document that contains a SOAP message that conforms to section 5 of the World Wide Web Consortium (www.w3.org) document, "Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) 1.1". 符合第 5 节的文档是一种特殊格式。Documents that conform to section 5 are in a special format. 最起码，此类文档包含 SOAP 消息的主要部分。At the very least, such a document includes the main body of the SOAP message. 但是，而不是所有类型以内联方式定义文档中，某些类型定义可被编码为对文档中的顶级元素的引用。However, rather than having all types defined inline in the document, some type definitions can be encoded as references to top-level elements in the document. 因此，对于为引用的主体中找到每个元素，必须有一个包含类型定义的相应元素。Thus, for every element found in the main body that is a reference, there must be a corresponding element that contains the type definition. 若要关联的引用元素和类型定义，该类型定义了`id`属性设置为一个唯一字符串 ID 和引用的元素具有`href`属性引用相同的 id。To correlate the referencing element and the type definition, the type definition has an `id` attribute set to a unique string ID and the referencing element has an `href` attribute that references the same ID. ``` 10000 1234 ``` 事件发生时在文档中找到的类型定义但没有参数的主要部分中引用它。The event occur when there is a type definition found in the document, but no parameter in the main body references it. 事件发生时，可以通过检查来检索未引用的对象的 XML 类型属性的类。When the event occurs, you can retrieve the XML type of the unreferenced object by examining the property of the class. 返回对象的 XML ID属性。The XML ID of the object is returned by the property. 事件不应与混淆和没有对应的 XML 节点或元素类型的类成员时，可能发生的事件。The event should not be confused with the and events, which occur when there is no class member that corresponds to the XML node or element type. ##
